CVRP Solution object

class solution.cvrp.solution.SolutionCvrp(instance: problem.cvrp.instance.Cvrp, route: List[solution.cvrp.route.RouteCvrp] = [])
__parseRoute(route_to_build: str) → solution.cvrp.route.RouteCvrp

parseRoute()

Method to parse a route from solution file. The route should be a string.

Parameters

route_to_build – The string of a line of the data file representing a route

Returns

The route object representing the route string passed as argument

Return type

RouteCvrp

__parseSol(data_to_parse: str) → None

parseSol()

Method to parse solution file. Either web or local file, since the argument must be a string

Parameters

data_to_parse – The string of the data file to parse

drawMatPlotLib()

Method to draw a figure of the solution (all routes displayed on the cvrp graph)

Parameters

  • route_color (List[str]) – List of colors of the routes in the solution, default the DEFAULT_COLOR_PALETTE (utils.colorpallete) (opt.)

  • depot_node_color (str) – Color of the node depot, default to “#a6f68e” (opt.)

  • route_to_display (List[int]) – Number of the routes to display on the solution (route number start at 1), default to None (opt.)

  • node_size (int) – Size of the nodes

  • auto_node_size (bool) – Set the size of the node automatically

Returns

Return a tuple containing (in that order): the graph, the layout of the graph, node color map (list of node color), edge color map (list of edge color), weight map (list of weight), node size (an integer to represent the node size)

Raises

IndexError – If a route to display does exists

drawPlotly()

Method to create the scatter that compose the graph made with plotly

Parameters

  • route_color – List of colors of the routes in the solution, default the DEFAULT_COLOR_PALETTE (utils.colorpallete) (opt.)

  • depot_node_color (str) – Color of the node depot, default to “#a6f68e” (opt.)

  • node_size (int) – Size of the nodes, default to 15 (opt)

  • show_legend_edge (bool) – Display or not the legend of edges, default to True (opt.)

  • show_legend_node – Display or not the legend of nodes, default to False (opt.)

Tyoe route_color

List[str]

Returns

Two lists of scatters, one of nodes and one of edges

Return type

Tuple(List[Scatter], List[Scatter])

drawPlotlyJSON(depot_node_color: str = '#a6f68e', node_size: int = 15, route_color: List[str] = ['#FF0000', '#0000FF', '#00FF00', '#E67300', '#9900cc', '#F0b8b8', '#72A0C1', '#008000', '#FFBF00', '#008080', '#000080', '#FFFF00', '#00FFFF', '#BDB76B', '#006400', '#6495ED', '#90EE90', '#800080', '#F0b8b8', '#FF69B4', '#F4A460', '#FFE4C4', '#40E0D0', '#FF8C00', '#FFD700', '#8FBC8F', '#ADD8E6', '#BA55D3', '#E6E6FA', '#D2691E', '#CC99CC', '#191970', '#ADFF2F', '#FF7F50', '#9900FF', '#FFCCBC', '#808080'], show_legend_edge: bool = True, show_legend_node: bool = False) → Dict

Parameters

  • depot_node_color (str) – Color of the node depot, default to “#a6f68e” (opt.)

  • node_size (int) – Size of the nodes, default to 15 (opt)

  • show_legend_edge (bool) – Display or not the legend of edges, default to True (opt.)

evaluation()

Method to get the cost of the solution (not rounded)

Returns

The cost (the sum of all distance between the nodes of the route)

Return type

float

fromJSON()

Method to transform a JSON into an object

Parameters

json (dict) – Json data of the object

Raises

KeyValueError if the json is incomplete

fromSarl()

Method to convert the sarl response into a solution

Parameters

sarl_response – Response made by sarl programm to convert into python solution

Type

str

getAllRouteSwapNeighbours()

Method to get all swaps possible of customers in a single route. Do this for each route of the solution.

Parameters

total_cost (float) – Total cost of the route (so it has not to be calculated again), default to None (opt.)

Returns

A list containing the new solutions with the customers swaps in a single route, and their cost

Return type

List[Tuple[SolutionCvrp, int]]

getClosestInsertionNeighbours()

Method to build new solution by swapping a customer between 2 adjacent route. The position difference between the customer in route1 and route2 is defined by proximity_swaps. Swaps between each routes of the solution.

Parameters

  • proximity_swaps (int) – Number of customer between to customer to swap between the route, default to 1 (opt.)

  • total_cost (float) – Total cost of the route (so it has not to be calculated again), default to None (opt.)

Returns

A list containing the new solutions with the customers swaps in a single route, and their cost

Return type

List[Tuple[SolutionCvrp, int]]

getClosestPermutationNeighbours()

Method to build new solution by swapping a customer between 2 adjacent route. The position difference between the customer in route1 and route2 is defined by proximity_swaps. Swaps between each routes of the solution.

Parameters

  • proximity_swaps (int) – Number of customer between to customer to swap between the route, default to 1 (opt.)

  • total_cost (float) – Total cost of the solution (so it has not to be calculated again), default to None (opt.)

Returns

A list containing the new solutions with the customers swaps in a single route, and their cost

Return type

List[Tuple[SolutionCvrp, int]]

getFigure()

Method to get a figure of the solution (all routes displayed on the cvrp graph)

Parameters

  • with_labels (bool) – Display or not the name of the nodes (node id), default to True (opt.)

  • route_color – List of colors of the routes in the solution, default the DEFAULT_COLOR_PALETTE (utils.colorpallete) (opt.)

  • route_color – List[str]

  • depot_node_color (str) – Color of the node depot, default to “#a6f68e” (opt.)

  • show_weight (bool) – True if the weight should be displayed on the edge, else False. Default to True (opt.)

  • route_to_display (List[int]) – Number of the routes to display on the solution (route number start at 1), default to None (opt.)

  • fig_size (Tuple[int, int]) – Size of the figure

  • node_size (int) – Size of the nodes

  • auto_node_size (bool) – Set the size of the node automatically

Returns

The graph figure of the solution of the cvrp

Return type

plt.figure

Exemple

>>> root = Tk.Tk()
>>> root.wm_title("Graph embedded in TK")
>>> root.wm_protocol('WM_DELETE_WINDOW', root.quit)
>>> figure = sol.getFigure()
>>> canvas = FigureCanvasTkAgg(figure, master=root)
>>> canvas.get_tk_widget().pack(side=Tk.TOP, fill=Tk.BOTH, expand=1)
>>> Tk.mainloop()
getFigurePlotly(depot_node_color: str = '#a6f68e', node_size: int = 15, route_color: List[str] = ['#FF0000', '#0000FF', '#00FF00', '#E67300', '#9900cc', '#F0b8b8', '#72A0C1', '#008000', '#FFBF00', '#008080', '#000080', '#FFFF00', '#00FFFF', '#BDB76B', '#006400', '#6495ED', '#90EE90', '#800080', '#F0b8b8', '#FF69B4', '#F4A460', '#FFE4C4', '#40E0D0', '#FF8C00', '#FFD700', '#8FBC8F', '#ADD8E6', '#BA55D3', '#E6E6FA', '#D2691E', '#CC99CC', '#191970', '#ADFF2F', '#FF7F50', '#9900FF', '#FFCCBC', '#808080'], show_legend_edge: bool = True, show_legend_node: bool = False) → str

getHtmlFigurePlotly()

Method to display the graph with plotly library

Parameters

  • route_color – List of colors of the routes in the solution, default the DEFAULT_COLOR_PALETTE (utils.colorpallete) (opt.)

  • depot_node_color (str) – Color of the node depot, default to “#a6f68e” (opt.)

  • node_size (int) – Size of the nodes, default to 15 (opt)

  • show_legend_edge (bool) – Display or not the legend of edges, default to True (opt.)

  • show_legend_node – Display or not the legend of nodes, default to False (opt.)

  • full_html (bool) – If True, produce a string containing a complete HTML document starting with an <html> tag. If False, produce a string containing a single <div> element. Default to True (opt.)

  • default_width (str) – he default figure width/height to use if the provided figure does not specify its own layout.width/layout.height property. May be specified in pixels as an integer (e.g. 500), or as a css width style string (e.g. ‘500px’, ‘100%’). Default to “100%” (opt.)

  • default_height – The default figure width/height to use if the provided figure does not specify its own layout.width/layout.height property. May be specified in pixels as an integer (e.g. 500), or as a css width style string (e.g. ‘500px’, ‘100%’). Default to “100%” (opt.)

Tyoe route_color

List[str]

getHtmlFigurePlotly()

Method to get the html code of the graph

Parameters

  • route_color – List of colors of the routes in the solution, default the DEFAULT_COLOR_PALETTE (utils.colorpallete) (opt.)

  • depot_node_color (str) – Color of the node depot, default to “#a6f68e” (opt.)

  • node_size (int) – Size of the nodes, default to 15 (opt)

  • show_legend_edge (bool) – Display or not the legend of edges, default to True (opt.)

  • show_legend_node – Display or not the legend of nodes, default to False (opt.)

  • full_html (bool) – If True, produce a string containing a complete HTML document starting with an <html> tag. If False, produce a string containing a single <div> element. Default to True (opt.)

  • default_width (str) – he default figure width/height to use if the provided figure does not specify its own layout.width/layout.height property. May be specified in pixels as an integer (e.g. 500), or as a css width style string (e.g. ‘500px’, ‘100%’). Default to “100%” (opt.)

  • default_height – The default figure width/height to use if the provided figure does not specify its own layout.width/layout.height property. May be specified in pixels as an integer (e.g. 500), or as a css width style string (e.g. ‘500px’, ‘100%’). Default to “100%” (opt.)

Tyoe route_color

List[str]

Returns

a html string

Return type

str

getInsertionNeighbours()

Method to build new solution by insertinh a customer between in a route. The position difference between the customer in route1 and route2 is defined by proximity_swaps. Swaps between each routes of the solution.

Parameters

  • proximity_swaps (int) – Number of customer between to customer to swap between the route, default to 1 (opt.)

  • total_cost (float) – Total cost of the solution (so it has not to be calculated again), default to None (opt.)

Returns

A list containing the new solutions with the customers swaps in a single route, and their cost

Return type

List[Tuple[SolutionCvrp, int]]

getOverDemand() → int

Method to get the demand of each that are over the vehicle capacity

Returns

The demand over

Return type

int

getPermutationNeighbours()

Method to build new solution by swapping a customer between 2 route. The position difference between the customer in route1 and route2 is defined by proximity_swaps. Swaps between each routes of the solution.

Parameters

  • proximity_swaps (int) – Number of customer between to customer to swap between the route, default to 1 (opt.)

  • total_cost (float) – Total cost of the route (so it has not to be calculated again), default to None (opt.)

Returns

A list containing the new solutions with the customers swaps in a single route, and their cost

Return type

List[Tuple[SolutionCvrp, int]]

getRouteOfCustomer(customer_id: int) → solution.cvrp.route.RouteCvrp

Method to find the route of a given customer

Parameters

customer_id (int) – Node id of the customer we search for

Returns

The route of the customer

Return type

RouteCvrp

getRouteSwapNeighbours()

Method to get a single swap for each customer in a single route. The swap is made between customers that are separated by proximity_swaps - 1 customers. Do this for each route of the solution.

Parameters

  • proximity_swaps (int) – Number of customer between to customer to swap in the route, default to 1 (opt.)

  • total_cost (float) – Total cost of the route (so it has not to be calculated again), default to None (opt.)

Returns

A list containing the new solutions with the customers swaps in a single route, and their cost

Return type

List[Tuple[SolutionCvrp, int]]

isSameSolution()

Method to know if 2 solutions are the same

Parameters

other (SolutionCvrp) – The solution to compare

Returns

True is the 2 solution are the same, False else

Return type

bool

isValid()

Method to know whether a solution is valid or not

Returns

True if the route is valid, False else

Return type

bool

readSolution()

Method to read solution of vrp on local machine

Parameters

file_path – Path of the file where the vrp instance is

Returns

Itself

Return type

:class:’SolutionCvrp’

Raises

  • FileNotFoundError – when the file has not been found

  • ValueError – when the solution could not have been parsed

Warning

Please ensure the format of the instance is correct. Exemples of the file format can be found on: http://vrp.atd-lab.inf.puc-rio.br/index.php/en/

Exemple

>>> cvrp_instance.readSolution(file_path="C:\Users\YourName\Documents\instance.sol")
readSolutionWeb()

Method to read solution of cvrp on internet

Parameters

url (str) – Url of the page where the vrp solution is

Returns

Itself

Return type

:class:’Cvrp’

Raises

  • AssertionError – when the requests failled to get data from the url

  • ValueError – when the solution could not have been parsed

Warning

If the url is incorrect raise a ValueError

Warning

Please ensure the format of the instance is correct. Exemples of the file format can be found on: http://vrp.atd-lab.inf.puc-rio.br/index.php/en/

Exemple

>>> cvrp_instance.readSolutionWeb(url="http://vrp.atd-lab.inf.puc-rio.br/media/com_vrp/instances/P/P-n16-k8.sol")
showFigure()

Method to display a figure of the solution (all routes displayed on the cvrp graph)

Parameters

  • with_labels (bool) – Display or not the name of the nodes (node id), default to True (opt.)

  • route_color – List of colors of the routes in the solution, default the DEFAULT_COLOR_PALETTE (utils.colorpallete) (opt.)

  • route_color – List[str]

  • depot_node_color (str) – Color of the node depot, default to “#a6f68e” (opt.)

  • show_weight (bool) – True if the weight should be displayed on the edge, else False. Default to True (opt.)

  • route_to_display (List[int]) – Number of the routes to display on the solution (route number start at 1), default to None (opt.)

  • node_size (int) – Size of the nodes

  • auto_node_size (bool) – Set the size of the node automatically

Exemple

>>> sol.showFigure()

getHtmlFigurePlotly()

Method to display the graph with plotly library

Parameters

  • route_color – List of colors of the routes in the solution, default the DEFAULT_COLOR_PALETTE (utils.colorpallete) (opt.)

  • depot_node_color (str) – Color of the node depot, default to “#a6f68e” (opt.)

  • node_size (int) – Size of the nodes, default to 15 (opt)

  • show_legend_edge (bool) – Display or not the legend of edges, default to True (opt.)

  • show_legend_node – Display or not the legend of nodes, default to False (opt.)

  • full_html (bool) – If True, produce a string containing a complete HTML document starting with an <html> tag. If False, produce a string containing a single <div> element. Default to True (opt.)

  • default_width (str) – he default figure width/height to use if the provided figure does not specify its own layout.width/layout.height property. May be specified in pixels as an integer (e.g. 500), or as a css width style string (e.g. ‘500px’, ‘100%’). Default to “100%” (opt.)

  • default_height – The default figure width/height to use if the provided figure does not specify its own layout.width/layout.height property. May be specified in pixels as an integer (e.g. 500), or as a css width style string (e.g. ‘500px’, ‘100%’). Default to “100%” (opt.)
